name: Growth & Company
slogan: Hunt growth wherever it is - pricing, product, process, channels, conversion, teams

jobs.title: Growth Marketing Manager
jobs.description:
# Summary
Growth & Company is looking for a Growth Marketing Manager with strong experience in paid media to join a leading London based direct-to-consumer, eCommerce startup. This beauty brand has seen excellent growth in the past 12 months and is looking for the ideal team member to lead the digital growth strategy and take full spectrum ownership of the brand’s growth ambitions to scale to the next level.
 
Brief summary of the company:
* Experienced Founder with a strong network within the beauty industry.
* Well funded DTC beauty start-up with supportive investors.
* Strong growth to date, looking to take the next step and scale up.
* Vibrant office located in East London with excellent public transport links.
 
Brief summary of the role:
* Lead acquisition campaigns through performance marketing channels such as Facebook and Google, to scale online sales.
* Improve media spend efficiency across paid media channels. 
* Find innovative routes to growth through product and marketing initiatives such as CRO.
* Work directly with a high degree of autonomy reporting directly to the Marketing Director.
* Clear path to becoming a Head of Growth.
 
# About The Company
This direct-to-consumer startup is an award winning beauty brand that is regularly featured in top fashion and beauty publications such as Vogue and Marie Claire, often receiving raving reviews from editors and customers alike.
 
The product’s roots lie in centuries old traditions that have been handed down through generations. Though the inspiration is rooted in ancient traditions, the formulas are crafted and produced locally in the UK - something that the brand is extremely proud of. It is these unique characteristics that have helped to solidify their position in the market, which at times can appear cluttered, and has helped to establish a tribe of loyal customers.
 
The beauty industry in the UK is worth more than £27bn/year. It was recently named the third-largest market operating in the UK, so the opportunity for the brand is enormous.
 
The future aim is simple: bring clean, naturally derived beauty products to a wider female audience.
 
With a diverse and inclusive culture, this leading beauty brand is a great environment for candidates from all different backgrounds and identities. Bring a fresh perspective and lead the team into a new phase of growth and beyond. In return you will have the opportunity to shape the role, enjoy some of the most rewarding work of your career and be an early and senior employee of a game-changing start-up. 
 
# What You’ll Do
The Growth Manager will lead customer acquisition and retention efforts with a particular emphasis on digital channels and should have strong skills and experience with paid social (Facebook & Instagram). 

This is an opportunity for an ambitious digital marketer to grow their strategic and commercial skills with a view to evolve their role into a Head of Growth in the near future. The ideal candidate will have access to and support from a team of experienced growth advisors in the form of ongoing training around holistic growth strategy and it’s consummate parts.
 
You are systems driven, experimental, and obsessed with developing a deep understanding of the brand's customers and use that to drive customer acquisition and continuous product improvement.

Reporting directly to the Marketing Director, you will oversee marketing strategies across different performance channels, while also taking a hands on approach to individual campaigns and experiments. 

This position is more than just a performance marketing role, you will have aspirations to learn more about and implement holistic growth marketing strategies - whether it be retention, experimentation, conversion, pricing optimization and developing processes. 

You will champion the brand both internally and externally, developing, testing and protecting the value proposition, messaging and community management.
 
Leading on innovation and commercial decisions you will help to create, test and launch new products and offerings to drive growth.
 
This is a new role, ideal for someone looking to put their performance marketing experience into practice and develop their strategic and analytical skills to become a well rounded head of growth. 
In this startup you will be encouraged to shape the scope of the position and make it your own, while also identifying and maximising opportunities for your own professional development.

**50% Driving performance:** 
* Optimising performance channels to hit weekly, quarterly and yearly KPIs.
* Ensuring growth projects are delivered on time.
* Owning marketing insights and data reporting.

**20% Channel innovation:** 
* Scoping, testing and scaling new channels. 
* Developing new ways to find, attract and retain customers. 
* Building a strong external growth network to leverage best practice. 
* Conducting consumer research to shape marketing and product development.

**20% Commercial leadership (with the support of the Marketing Director and growth advisors):** 
* Owning unit economics, pricing decisions and the trade-offs that entails, including conversion, LTV, volume.
* Owning the roadmap to increase retention and LTV.

**10% Internal processes:**
* Shaping world-class internal processes to drive strong commercial and resource efficiency.

# The Skills You’ll Need
We are open-minded as to the person who best meets the requirements of this role. You may have a media agency background or have worked internally at another DTC startup in a growth or marketing capacity.

The key skills that will make you successful in this role are:

* A data and evidence-driven approach to marketing. Highly analytical and able to break down complex decisions into hypotheses that can be tested. 
* Experience with performance marketing channels. Have a strong understanding of Facebook and Google ads.
* Curiosity. The ability to learn and adapt quickly.
* Resilience. Can you pick yourself up when things go wrong?
* Drive. A hunger to keep pushing to make things better, faster, cheaper, smarter. 
* An entrepreneurial and innovative mindset. A determination to develop new ideas and approaches that no one else is doing.
* The gravitas to champion your ideas internally.

# Practical Details
On offer is an attractive salary package, Macbook laptop, brand/industry benefits and unique career progression in return for your hard work. 
 
Personal and professional development is a priority and as well as training opportunities you will have access to a team of experienced growth advisors along with the investors network, both of which are on hand for mentorship and knowledge-sharing.
 
All of this in a vibrant office located in East London, just a stone's throw from the heart of London’s startup scene.
 
# Application and Interview Process
Growth & Company has partnered with this DTC beauty brand to find the person who will best fit this role.  
Tell us why you’re an ideal candidate but also how this opportunity fits in with your career and future ambitions. Take your time and tell us your story, but please keep it succinct.
 
If we think you’re a good match, after an initial chat with us you’ll be put forward for face-to-face interviews at the brand, followed by a technical test with Growth & Company.  
 
# Want To Know More?
To find out more, or for an informal discussion about the role, contact Ben Bocarro: Ben@growthandcompany.com

# About Growth & Company
Growth & Company partners with founders and investors to accelerate growth. We use data, insight and experience to prioritise the activities that will drive business growth as well as coaching, training and hiring growth teams.
